title: Dramatic images from the Hong Kong protests
text:
Police clash with demonstrators in Hong Kong, Oct. 1, 2019. Clashes reached their most intense point in four months of protests on the same day Beijing celebrated 70 years of Communist Party rule. Lam Yik Fei/The New York Times via Redux

Anti-government demonstrators are seen through a glass with peeled off posters, Oct. 1, 2019. Vincent Yu/AP

A man reacts after being tear gassed in Hong Kong, Oct. 1, 2019, during clashes with police. Mark Ralston/AFP/Getty Images

Demonstrators throw Molotov cocktails at the entrance of Cheung Sha Wan Government Office, Oct. 1, 2019, in Hong Kong. Billy H.C. Kwok/Getty Images

A pro-democracy protester burns parts of a 70th Anniversary banner during a march on September 29, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Chris Mcgrath/Getty Images

Students gather during a school children's strike event in support of protest movement in Hong Kong Monday, Sept. 30, 2019. Gemunu Amarasinghe/AP

Hong Kong police react to tear gas during a protest in Hong Kong on Sunday, Sept. 29, 2019. Kin Cheung/AP

Police clash with protestors in Hong Kong, China, Sept. 29, 2019. Gemunu Amarasinghe/AP

Police use tear gas to dispel protestors in Hong Kong, Sept. 29, 2019. Vincent Thian/AP

A pro-democracy protester is tackled and arrested by police during clashes after a march on September 29, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Chris Mcgrath/Getty Images

Riot police pepper spray at member of media in Causeway Bay after a clash with protesters on September 29, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

Protestors destroy a taxi in Hong Kong, China, Sept. 29, 2019. Felipe Dana/AP

A protestor hurls back an exploded tear gas shell at police officers in Hong Kong, Saturday, Aug. 31, 2019. Jae C. Hong/AP Photo

Protesters light a barricade on fire during an anti-government rally in Hong Kong, China, Aug. 31, 2019. Vivek Prakash/epa-efe/rex/VIVEK PRAKASH/EPA-EFE/REX

Police fire tear gas at protesters during an anti-government rally in Hong Kong, China, 31 August 2019. Jerome Favre/epa-efe/rex/JEROME FAVRE/EPA-EFE/REX

Local residents and protestors shout at police in Sham Shui Po on August 29, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Billy H.C. Kwok/Getty Images

Riot police arrest protesters after clashes in Sham Shui Po on August 29, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Billy H.C. Kwok/Getty Images

People light up their smartphones as they take part in a rally at the financial district in Hong Kong, Aug. 28, 2019. Kin Cheung/AP

Riot police fire tear gas to disperse anti-government protesters outside a shopping mall in Tsuen Wan, Hong Kong, China, on Aug 25, 2019. Sunny Mok/EPN/Newscom

A demonstrator uses a tennis racket to hit back tear gas canisters during clashes with police after an anti-government rally, Aug. 25, 2019, in Hong Kong. Chris Mcgrath/Getty Images

A policeman points his gun toward demonstrators on a street during a protest in Hong Kong, Aug. 25, 2019. Kin Cheung/AP

An anti-riot police vehicle equipped with a water cannon clears the road from a barricade set up by demonstrators during an anti-government rally in Hong Kong, Aug. 25, 2019. Jerome Favre/EPA/Shutterstock

Riot police clash with demonstrators during a protest in Hong Kong, China, August 24, 2019. Thomas Peter/Reuters

People light up mobile phones at the hill top of Lion Rock in Hong Kong on August 23, 2019. Thousands of people held hands across Hong Kong late August 23 in a dazzling, neon-framed recreation of a pro-democracy "Baltic Way" protest against Soviet rule three decades ago. Philip Fong/AFP/Getty Images

Demonstrators fill a multilane main road during a march in the Causeway Bay shopping district of Hong Kong, Aug. 18, 2019. After days of violence and warnings from the Chinese government, organizers estimated at least 1.7 million people had turned out to march through the city center in the pouring rain. Lam Yik Fei/The New York Times/Redux

Demonstrators gather at Victoria Park in Hong Kong, Aug. 18, 2019. Kin Cheung/AP

Pro-democracy protesters attend a rally in Hong Kong on August 16, 2019. Manan Vatsyayana/AFP/Getty Images

Police fire tear gas to clear pro-Democracy protesters during a demonstration on Hungry Ghost Festival day in the Sham Shui Po district on August 14, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

A protester attempts to kick a tear gas canister during a demonstration on Hungry Ghost Festival day in Sham Shui Po district on August 14, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

Anti-extradition bill protesters watch as demonstrators point laser pens at the police station in Sham Shui Po in Hong Kong, China, August 14, 2019. Thomas Peter/Reuters

A Hong Kong policeman falls backwards as they scuffle with pro-democracy protesters during ongoing demonstrations at Hong Kong's International Airport, Aug. 13, 2019. Hundreds of flights were cancelled or suspended at Hong Kong's airport as pro-democracy protesters staged a disruptive sit-in at the sprawling complex, defying warnings from the city's leader who said they were heading down a "path of no return." Manan Vatsyayana/AFP/Getty Images

Policemen with batons and shields shout at protesters during a demonstration at the Airport in Hong Kong, Aug. 13, 2019. Vincent Yu/AP

Police clash with protesters at the airport in Hong Kong, Aug. 13, 2019. Thomas Peter/Reuters

A tourist gives her luggage to security guards as she tries to enter the departures gate during while demonstrations continued at Hong Kong's International Airport, Aug. 13, 2019. Philip Fong/AFP/Getty Images

Demonstrators form a barricade as they clash with riot police at Hong Kong International Airport, Aug. 13, 2019. Rick Findler/REX via Shutterstock

Protesters occupy the departure hall of the Hong Kong International Airport, Aug. 12, 2019. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

A protester is detained by police during a demonstration, Aug. 3, 2019, in Hong Kong, China. Pro-democracy protesters have continued to rally on the streets of Hong Kong against a controversial extradition bill even after Hong Kong's Chief Executive Carrie Lam apologized for introducing the bill and declared it "dead." Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

A bleeding man is escorted by police after he was attacked by demonstrators in Hong Kong, July 31, 2019. Demonstrators clashed with police in Hong Kong after reports that some of their detained colleagues would be charged with the relatively serious charge of rioting. Vincent Yu/AP

Thousands of Hong Kong protesters participate in a march from a public park to call for an independent investigation into police tactics, July 21, 2019. Vincent Yu/AP

Pro-Beijing demonstrators gather outside the Legislative Council Complex to show their support for the police, July 20, 2019, in Hong Kong. Chris Mcgrath/Getty Images

Protesters storm into the government headquarters in Hong Kong, July 1, 2019. Vivek Prakash/AFP/Getty Images

A person sprays paint over Hong Kong's coats of arms inside the chamber after protesters broke into the Legislative Council building during the anniversary of Hong Kong's handover to China, July 1, 2019, in Hong Kong. Tyrone Siu/Reuters

Ten of thousands of protesters flood the streets during a rally in Hong Kong, July 1, 2019. Kin Cheung/AP

Protesters take part in a rally in Hong Kong, June 26, 2019, capping a daylong appeal to world leaders ahead of a G-20 summit. Kin Cheung/AP

Protesters fill the streets of Hong Kong to rally against the extradition bill ahead of 2019 G20 Osaka summit, June 26, 2019 in Hong Kong. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

A man holds eggs in his hand to throw at the police as thousands of protesters surround the police headquarter in Hong Kong, June 21, 2019. Paula Bronstein/Getty Images

People listen to speeches during a "mums protest" against alleged police brutality and the proposed extradition treaty, near the Legislative Council building on June 14, 2019, in Hong Kong. Carl Court/Getty Images

Police man a road as protesters attend a rally against a controversial extradition law proposal outside the government headquarters in Hong Kong, June 12, 2019. Dale De La Rey/AFP/Getty Images

A demonstrator sits down in front of riot police during a demonstration to demand authorities scrap a proposed extradition bill with China, in Hong Kong, June 12, 2019. Tyrone Siu/Reuters
description: Anger over an extradition bill leads to mass demonstrations in Hong Kong, filling streets and shutting down the airport.
